target_markets.market_description: College students and recent graduates seeking career advancement

apps with 100,000+ monthly users making $15M annually

problems_validated.problem: Calorie tracking is archaic and difficult for end users
problems_validated.severity: high - tons of people have gripes with existing solutions

problems_validated.problem: Career advancement tools are fragmented across multiple platforms
problems_validated.severity: high - affects all college students and job seekers
problems_validated.current_solutions: separate websites for resume analysis, career quizzes, job application courses

business_strategies.strategy: Intersection of AI functionality with novel distribution tactics

problems_solutions.solution: Use GPT Vision API instead of building from scratch

startup_ideas.idea: Career AI - all-in-one career advancement platform
startup_ideas.problem_solved: fragmented career tools and job search difficulties
startup_ideas.validation: target students through Instagram reels, leverage LinkedIn and Twitter

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Putting all eggs in one trendy viral distribution basket
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: limited growth and vulnerability to platform changes
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: engage in highly iterative process across multiple channels
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Blake's approach of testing multiple hooks and positioning strategies
